libgenr 0.1.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

    libgenr Quickstart Guide

    libgenr.Rmd

    Library Genesis (LibGen) is a search engine for articles and books on various topics, which allows free access to content that is otherwise paywalled or not digitalized elsewhere. There are two documented ways to use the free public LiGgen API to query the LibGen database: by text ID, or by date, which means that it does not support the most common use – searching for texts. The purpose of this package (libgenr) is not only wrapping on top of the two ways of queries, but also providing search and download functions. This vignette goes through functionality of libgenr package and explains the basics into querying the LibGen databases.

    About fields

    There are a great many of fields available in LibGen database. Sometimes you don’t want to get all of the details of a book, instead you simply want to look at basic informations to see if it’s the book you want. You can achieve that by specifying fields in libgenr functions and you’ll see this later. Right now, let’s focus on fields that you can take a look at:

    • ID
    • Title
    • VolumeInfo
    • Series
    • Periodical
    • Author
    • Year
    • Edition
    • Publisher
    • City
    • Pages
    • Language
    • Topic
    • Library
    • Issue
    • Identifier
    • ISSN
    • ASIN
    • UDC
    • LBC
    • DDC
    • LCC
    • Doi
    • Googlebookid
    • OpenLibraryID
    • Commentary
    • DPI
    • Color
    • Cleaned
    • Orientation
    • Paginated
    • Scanned
    • Bookmarked
    • Searchable
    • Filesize
    • Extension
    • MD5
    • CRC32
    • eDonkey
    • AICH
    • SHA1
    • TTH
    • Generic
    • Visible
    • Locator
    • Local
    • TimeAdded
    • TimeLastModified
    • Coverurl
    • identifierwodash
    • tags
    • pagesinfile
    • descr
    • toc
    • tth
    • sha1
    • aich
    • btih
    • torrent
    • crc32

    Above list of fields is called full_fields in this package. To avoid redundancy, returning fields of all functions defaults to partial_fields listed below:

    • ID
    • Title
    • VolumeInfo
    • Series
    • Periodical
    • Author
    • Year
    • Edition
    • Publisher
    • Pages
    • Language
    • Topic
    • Library
    • Issue
    • Identifier
    • ISSN
    • Filesize
    • Extension
    • MD5
    • CRC32
    • Locator
    • TimeAdded
    • TimeLastModified
    • torrent

    If you think even the partial_fields is redundant, feel free to decide which fields to return on your own!

    Get book data by ID

    As mentioned above, one main way of query the LibGen database is using book ID. If you know the ID of books you need, simply use libgen_ID_retrive() to pull your book info:

    ID<-c(1,10,100,1000,10000)
books<-libgen_ID_retrieve(ID)
kable(books)%>%
  kable_styling(bootstrap_options ="condensed")%>%
  scroll_box(width = '700px')
    id title volumeinfo series periodical author year edition publisher pages language topic library issue identifier issn filesize extension md5 crc32 locator timeadded timelastmodified torrent

    10 Чтобы спина не болела [Болезни позвоночника и их профилактика Киреева Т.Н. 1995 Сов. спорт 130 Russian 172 Kolxo3 17 5-85009-444-X 1437438 djvu 8FCB740B8C13F202E89E05C4937C09AC 2C9ABC64 B_Biology/Chtoby spina ne bolela (1995)(ru)(T)(130s)B.djvu 2009-07-20 03:45:11 2017-08-09 08:41:09 ZDQ6aW5mb2Q2Omxlbmd0aGkxNDM3NDM4ZTQ6bmFtZTMyOjhmY2I3NDBiOGMxM2YyMDJlODllMDVjNDkzN2MwOWFjMTI6cGllY2UgbGVuZ3RoaTE2Nzc3MjE2ZTY6cGllY2VzMjA6kkWr3a6V5rXhDqbeuq4H8BSuEzNlZQ==

    Or specify your fields:

    ID<-c(1,10,100,1000,10000)
fields<-c("ID","Title","Author","Publisher","Edition")
books<-libgen_ID_retrieve(ID,fields=fields)
kable(books)%>%
  kable_styling(bootstrap_options ="condensed")
    id title author publisher edition
    1 Handbook of Clinical Drug Data Philip Anderson McGraw-Hill Medical 10
    10 Чтобы спина не болела [Болезни позвоночника и их профилактика Киреева Т.Н. Сов. спорт
    100 Carnivorous plants of the world James Pietropaolo, Patricia Pietropaolo Timber Press, Incorporated
    1000 Modern computer algebra Joachim von zur Gathen, Jürgen Gerhard Cambridge University Press 1
    10000 Mathematical carnival Martin Gardner Mathematical Association of America

    Search the database

    Most of the time we don’t know about book IDs, but we do want to query about books just like using Google. libgen_search() gives you the option to search the database. It also allows you to search a single field or sort by a single field. Note that default number of records to return is 25. I will set it to 5 for simplicity.

    A simple search

    fields<-c("ID","Title","Author","Publisher","Edition","Language")
books<-libgen_search("data structures",count=5,fields=fields)
kable(books)%>%
  kable_styling(bootstrap_options ="condensed")
    id title author publisher edition language
    728 Algorithms and theory of computation handbook Mikhail J. Atallah CRC Press 1 English
    750 Algorithms and Data Structures: Workshop WADS ’89 Ottawa, Canada, August 17–19, 1989 Proceedings Ricardo A. Baeza-Yates, Gaston H. Gonnet (auth.), F. Dehne, J. -R. Sack, N. Santoro (eds.) Springer-Verlag Berlin Heidelberg 1 English
    754 Data Structures and Algorithms in C++ Adam Drozdek Brooks/Cole 2nd ed English
    764 Handbook of algorithms and data structures: in Pascal and C Gaston H. Gonnet, Gaston Gonnet, Ricardo Baeza-Yates, R. Baeza-Yates Addison-Wesley Pub. Co 2nd ed English
    792 Data structures and Algorithms 3: Multi-Dimensional Searching and Computational Geometry Kurt Mehlhorn Springer English

    Search in a column using search_in= 

    fields<-c("ID","Title","Author","Publisher","Edition","Language")
books<-libgen_search("John",count=5,fields=fields,search_in = 'Author')
kable(books)%>%
  kable_styling(bootstrap_options ="condensed")
    id title author publisher edition language
    13 Mathematical models in biology. An introduction Elizabeth S. Allman, John A. Rhodes Cambridge University Press 1 English
    14 Mathematical models in biology: solution manual Elizabeth S. Allman, John A. Rhodes Cambridge University Press 1 English
    15 Cambridge handbook of psychology, health and medicine Susan Ayers, Andrew Baum, Chris McManus, Stanton Newman, Kenneth Wallston, John Weinman, Robert West Cambridge University Press 2 English
    36 Ordinal Measurement in the Behavioral Sciences Norman Cliff, John A. Keats Psychology Press 1 English
    57 Introduction to genetic analysis William Fixsen, Diane K. Lavett, Lianna Johnson, John Merriam, Paul G. Young W. H. Freeman 8th English

    Search with sorting using sort_by= 

    fields<-c("ID","Title","Author","Publisher","Year","Language")
books<-libgen_search("classical music",count=5,fields=fields,sort_by = 'Year',reverse=TRUE, search_in = "Title")
kable(books)%>%
  kable_styling(bootstrap_options ="condensed")
    id title author publisher year language
    4 2445882 Recording Classical Music Robert Toft Routledge 2020 English
    5 2445900 Recording Classical Music Robert Toft Focal Press/Routledge/Taylor & Francis Group 2020 English
    1 2336736 Expect the Unexpected: A Life in Classical Music Kent Nagano; Inge Kloepfer McGill-Queen’s University Press 2019 English
    2 2337048 Expect the Unexpected: A Life in Classical Music Kent Nagano, Inge Kloepfer McGill-Queen’s University Press 2019 English
    3 2389984 Black Classical Musicians and Composers, 1500–2000 Rodreguez King-Dorset McFarland & Company 2019 English

    As you may notice, I set reverse = TRUE to sort reversely. If we sort ascendingly, those records with no value on that field would come up first.

    Get the latest changes of the database

    We can get the latest added or modified records using libgen_new_uploads(), although function might not be as helpful as the previous one.

    Get last uploads using mode = last (default value)

    fields<-c("ID","Title","Author","Year","Language","TimeAdded","TimeLastModified")
books<-libgen_new_uploads(timefirst = Sys.Date(), count=5,fields = fields,mode='last')
kable(books)%>%
  kable_styling(bootstrap_options ="condensed")
    id title author year language timeadded timelastmodified
    2448157 A crucificação de Cristo descrita por um cirurgião Pierre Barbet 2018 Portuguese 2019-12-11 00:01:00 2019-12-11 00:01:42
    2448158 The Vegan Eggz Cookbook Skye Michael Conroy 2016 English 2019-12-11 00:03:08 2019-12-11 00:03:09
    2448159 The Gentle Sea Cookbook Skye Michael Conroy 2017 English 2019-12-11 00:05:27 2019-12-11 00:05:28
    2448160 Ensaio s obre teoria da história em Marx. Jean Paulo Pereira de Menezes 0 Português 2019-12-11 00:10:35 2019-12-11 00:10:36
    2448161 Seitan and Beyond: Gluten and Soy-Based Meat Analogues for the Ethical Gourmet Skye Michael Conroy 2015 English 2019-12-11 00:11:26 2019-12-11 00:11:27

    Notice that timefirst is current day, and there is also timelast which defaults to current day. You can change them both in the format of ‘YYYY-MM-DD’.

    Besides count, you can also specify where to start using first =.

    Get last modified using mode = modified 

    fields<-c("ID","Title","Author","Year","Language","TimeAdded","TimeLastModified")
books<-libgen_new_uploads(timefirst = '2018-12-25', timelast = ' 2018-12-26' ,count=5,
                          fields = fields,mode='modified')
kable(books)%>%
  kable_styling(bootstrap_options ="condensed")
    id title author year language timeadded timelastmodified
    2302224 Talking to North Korea: Ending the Nuclear Standoff Glyn Ford 2018 English 2018-12-24 23:59:59 2018-12-25 00:00:00
    2302225 Anti-Semitism and Anti-Zionism in Historical Perspective: Convergence and Divergence Jeffrey Herf 2006 English 2018-12-25 00:39:58 2018-12-25 00:40:05
    2302227 Antisemitism and the American Far Left Stephen H. Norwood 2013 English 2018-12-25 00:46:03 2018-12-25 00:46:05
    2302228 From Ambivalence to Betrayal: The Left, the Jews, and Israel Robert S. Wistrich 2012 English 2018-12-25 00:46:32 2018-12-25 00:46:32
    2302226 Radical French Thought and the Return of the -Jewish Question Éric Marty; Alan Astro; Bruno Chaouat 2015 English 2018-12-25 00:40:05 2018-12-25 01:01:28

    Download a book to your PC

    One of the most amazing things about LibGen is that you can always find electronic copy of your wanted book. There are multiple mirrors to download books from LibGen databases, and in libgen_download() I used this one: http://93.174.95.29/. The function always download the file into your current working directory.

    fields<-c("ID","Title","Author","Publisher","Edition","md5")
books<-libgen_search("statistical learning with application in R",count=5,fields=fields)
kable(books)%>%
  kable_styling(bootstrap_options ="condensed")
    id title author publisher edition md5
    917808 An Introduction to Statistical Learning with Applications in R Gareth James, Daniela Witten, Trevor Hastie, Robert Tibshirani Springer 4413a24c7d70f6ac12a764a76cc7e514
    1188916 An Introduction to Statistical Learning with Applications in R Gareth James, Daniela Witten, Trevor Hastie, Robert Tibshirani Springer Corrected at 4 printing f69a8bc47af131bfa33ee8d6e360d579
    1709117 An Introduction to Statistical Learning with Applications in R Gareth James, Daniela Witten, Trevor Hastie, Robert Tibshirani Springer 627cd575a213cdb7ce4512d88c97011c
    1984763 A Statistical Approach to Genetic Epidemiology: Concepts and Applications, with an e-Learning Platform Ziegler A., Konig I.R., Pahlke F. d691551ad91c1d5170ecad5b469f9344
    2321432 An Introduction to Statistical Learning: With Applications in R Gareth James; Trevor Hastie; Robert Tibshirani; Daniela Witten Springer Hardcover fe0e921529d34aa057703d54bf968e89

    After searching for your book, use the md5 field for downloading.

    #libgen_download(books[5,'md5'])

    Clean your results

    You can tell whether a certain field is in your data by calling has_field().

    has_field('language',books)
#< [1] FALSE

    You can also filter on fields using clean_field(). This function accepts random number of arguments. If you want to have results where a certain field is not empty, simply pass 'fieldname' as an argument. Or if you want to have results where a certain field equals to a value, pass "fieldname" = value as an argument.

    fields<-c("ID","Title","Author","Publisher","Edition","Language")
books<-libgen_new_uploads(timefirst ="2019-12-10", count=20,fields = fields,mode='last')
kable(books)%>%
  kable_styling(bootstrap_options ="condensed")
    id title author publisher edition language
    2447901 Rolfing and Physical Reality Ida P. Rolf Healing Arts Press Paperback English
    2447902 Гарри Поттер и методы рационального мышления Элиезер Юдковский hpmor.ru eBook Russian
    2447903 Sobre os Canibais GALINDO, Caetano W. Portuguese
    2447904 Эволюция, движение, деятельность Алексей Николаевич Леонтьев English
    2447905 O irlandês Charles Brandt Seoman 1ª Portuguese
    2447906 Administrative Burden: Policymaking by Other Means Herd, Pamela; Moynihan, Donald P. Russell Sage Foundation English
    2447907 Body Mind Mastery: Training for Sport and Life Dan Millman New World Library Paperback English
    2447908 Engagement in Professional Genres Carmen Sancho Guinda John Benjamins Publishing Company English
    2447909 Monsters of Contact: Historical Trauma in Caddoan Oral Traditions Mark van de Logt University of Oklahoma Press English
    2447910 Engagement in Professional Genres Carmen Sancho Guinda John Benjamins Publishing Company English
    2447911 Applying Luhmann to Translation Studies: Translation in Society Luhmann, Niklas; Tyulenev, Sergey; Luhmann, Niklas Routledge English
    2447912 9 правил жизненной силы (Метод Фельденкрайза) Анат Баниэль Питер Russian
    2447913 Applying Luhmann to Translation Studies: Translation in Society Luhmann, Niklas; Tyulenev, Sergey; Luhmann, Niklas Routledge English
    2447914 Being Jewish and Doing Justice: Bringing Argument to Life Klug, Brian; Sherwin, Byron L. Vallentine Mitchell New. English
    2447915 Возвращение домой, в свое тело! (Метод Фельденкрайза) Памела Фри Диля Russian
    2447916 China’s Global Identity: Considering the Responsibilities of Great Power Hoo, Tiang Boon Georgetown University Press English
    2447917 China’s Global Identity: Considering The Responsibilities Of Great Power Tiang Boon Hoo Georgetown University Press English
    2447918 Describing Prescriptivism: Usage Guides and Usage Problems in British and American English Ingrid Tieken-Boon van Ostade Routledge English
    2447919 Телесное осознание: психофизические упражнения (основано на методе Фельденкрайза) Роберт Мастерс София Russian
    2447920 Introducción a la econometría Trívez Bielsa, Francisco Javier Difusora Larousse - Ediciones Pirámide Spanish

    Based on above results, if we want to remove records without publisher and restrict language to English:

    clean_books<-clean_field(books,"publisher","language"="English")
kable(clean_books)%>%
  kable_styling(bootstrap_options ="condensed")
    id title author publisher edition language
    1 2447901 Rolfing and Physical Reality Ida P. Rolf Healing Arts Press Paperback English
    6 2447906 Administrative Burden: Policymaking by Other Means Herd, Pamela; Moynihan, Donald P. Russell Sage Foundation English
    7 2447907 Body Mind Mastery: Training for Sport and Life Dan Millman New World Library Paperback English
    8 2447908 Engagement in Professional Genres Carmen Sancho Guinda John Benjamins Publishing Company English
    9 2447909 Monsters of Contact: Historical Trauma in Caddoan Oral Traditions Mark van de Logt University of Oklahoma Press English
    10 2447910 Engagement in Professional Genres Carmen Sancho Guinda John Benjamins Publishing Company English
    11 2447911 Applying Luhmann to Translation Studies: Translation in Society Luhmann, Niklas; Tyulenev, Sergey; Luhmann, Niklas Routledge English
    13 2447913 Applying Luhmann to Translation Studies: Translation in Society Luhmann, Niklas; Tyulenev, Sergey; Luhmann, Niklas Routledge English
    14 2447914 Being Jewish and Doing Justice: Bringing Argument to Life Klug, Brian; Sherwin, Byron L. Vallentine Mitchell New. English
    16 2447916 China’s Global Identity: Considering the Responsibilities of Great Power Hoo, Tiang Boon Georgetown University Press English
    17 2447917 China’s Global Identity: Considering The Responsibilities Of Great Power Tiang Boon Hoo Georgetown University Press English
